fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * inserting Code Block in table, and changing the cell color of any cell in the same row breaks table by not allowing columns to be added or removed. 

h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Cloud



h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table with at least two columns. (For simplicity, 2x1 works)
 # Insert Code Block macro in any column.
 # Change the cell background color of any cell in the same row (doesn't matter which).
 # Observe that rows can no longer be added to the table, after or before

h3. Expected Results

* adding columns in front or after
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
aeTable.js:600 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'elm' of undefined
at A (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor-plugins.afd2af072ea43f037112-v17.js:1:23988)
at n.j [as insertRow] (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor-plugins.afd2af072ea43f037112-v17.js:1:23532)
at mceTableInsertRowAfter (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor-plugins.afd2af072ea43f037112-v17.js:1:38671)
at g.<anonymous> (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor-plugins.afd2af072ea43f037112-v17.js:1:39863)
at P.exec.(anonymous function) (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor.d923532ab35e110d7136-v17.js:1:263712)
at Object.g [as execCommand] (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor.d923532ab35e110d7136-v17.js:1:262787)
at g.execCommand (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor.d923532ab35e110d7136-v17.js:1:403754)
at g.b [as execCommand] (https://d245y5s2hyv7y6.cloudfront.net/testing124.atlassian.net/wiki/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/1502355477/h/7824799b2f3d59e9ffe68ba60b097bb8/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:507:505)
at Object.execCommand (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor.d923532ab35e110d7136-v17.js:1:419264)
at click (https://d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/atlassian-editor-plugins.afd2af072ea43f037112-v17.js:11:132324){noformat}
\{noformat}
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

If you change the color to no color\{white) you can then change the cell color again and insert after or before columns
fields.summary: Inserting/removing rows after inserting code macro and changing cell color breaks table

fields.description:
In Confluence, when creating a new page, the user will open a draft which will become the page once it's published. While on the editor, the breadcrumbs will point to the *root page* of the space, instead of the current parent that the page will be created as a child. 

For example, under the draft, it's pointing to the Home page of the space (a personal one, in this case), instead of the current parent page:

!testing.png|thumbnail!

Once the page is published, it will point to the correct breadcrumb:

!correct.png|thumbnail!

This is a suggestion to have the drafts pointing to the current parent as it can confuse users while creating content.
fields.summary: Draft Breadcrumbs Should Point to Current Parent Page

fields.description:
At the moment it is very hard to determine who has access where and with what rights if you have 100+ users and 40+ spaces. To check someone's permissions I have to open ALL spaces permissions page and check it one by one - very time consuming. It is hard to imagine how does it look for 500+ users and 200+ spaces...

To workaround this I'm using groups like:
 * SPACEKEY-admin
 * SPACEKEY-pm
 * SPACEKEY-editor
 * SPACEKEY-reader

assign groups to spaces with appropriate permission matrix and than users to the groups. This way I can just check the groups user belongs to to quickly determine his access level and spaces.

I wish you implemented a JIRA-like Roles mechanism so I can create Global Roles (like space-admin, space-editor, space-reader) with Global or Per-project permission matrix so I don't have to "workaround" this using groups as for the long run with this approach we will end up with A LOT of groups.
fields.summary: Introduce roles for Confluence Spaces
Pasting gtm javascript into Code Block macro strips format

fields.description:
With the new look of the editor, the "Undo" and "Redo" buttons are no longer present and these actions must be done using keyboard shortcuts or the top bar menu for the browser application itself.

Would you be able to re-add these buttons?
fields.summary: Re-add the "Undo" and "Redo" buttons to the new editor look

fields.description: As an Admin, I would like to have a permission level that would allow a specific group of users to be able to change General Look and Feel configurations on Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: Create Designer Permission Level

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Copying and pasting a table row with a Code Block macro, not working properly

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Create 1x1 Table
# Insert Code Block in the first column
# Use the Editor Toolbar to *Copy* the row
# Click on the Editor Toolbar *Paste* button

h3.Expected Behavior
Another identical row will be created

h3.Actual Results
Two rows are created on top of the copied one, one with the content from the Code Block, and the other one is the copied row.

See attached GIF
 !bug3.gif!
fields.summary: Pasting row with Code Block not working properly

fields.description:
I am looking to create a "status" on a panel that would be triggered from our "On-Call" schedule calendar for all regional teams across the country. 

 

Example - We have list of Engineers in a region, when it is that engineers week for on call, a "status" would be triggered to "green" for on call.  

 

Are there any current macros that would allow for me to do this? I've done some digging but not seeing any options.
fields.summary: Status alerts from calendar events

fields.description:
Disable the autocomplete for numbered lists markdown since not all users use them in the same indentation or format as the one from the editor. 

An example would be "1)" that also is rendered as "1.", the users do not have enough flexibility with the editor for this kind of lists.
fields.summary: Disable Autocomplete for Numbered Lists Markdown

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Email notifications are not sent to page or space watchers when editing a page, even with the "notify watchers" checked.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# on a page that is being watched, edit that page while notify watchers is checked

h3. Expected Results

All watchers get a notification email for the update to the page.

h3. Actual Results
The email is never sent and this shows up and an error like this shows up in the logs:
{noformat}

Listener: com.atlassian.streamhub.p2plugin.confluence.listener.ConfluenceEventListener event: com.atlassian.confluence.api.model.event.content.ContentUpdatedEvent at 
com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:55) at

...

fields.description: As an admin on a Confluence instance with several spaces, I would like to know which are the Spaces that are inactive - with no new pages, comments or attachments - over the last 180 days.
fields.summary: Check for Inactive Spaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After page contain image are being export to pdf, the image in pdf is blurr.


h3. Steps to replicate

# Create a page
# Add an image into the page and save the page
# Export the page to pdf or word

h3. Observed Behaviour

The image in pdf/word file is blurr.


h3. Expected behaviour

The image is not blurr in pdf/word file.
fields.summary: Images are blurr after being export to Pdf or Word

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Auto Suggestion at Restriction page is not working at IE11 browser.

h3. How to Replicate
# Go to the page in Confluence.
# Open the ellipsis(...) menu and choose Restrictions.
# Choose the drop-down Viewing and Editing restricted.
# Type the username in the search box.

h3.Expected Result
* Able to show suggestion username at IE11 browser.

h3.Actual Result
* Suggestion username is not showing at IE11 browser.

h3.Workaround
# Use another browser e.g Firefox or Chrome.
fields.summary: Auto Suggestion at Restriction page is not working at IE11 browser.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to create a single JIRA issue from a highlighted text in a Confluence page, the results of the attempt will alternate between success and failure to add the JIRA issue macro for the corresponding issue but, indeed,  does create the JIRA issue in the Jira's side in all the attempts. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In any Confluence page, create a JIRA issue from highlighted text. The issue might not be created for the first time for Confluence. 
# In the same page, follow-up immediately with creating another single issue. The result might be positive or not. 

h3. Expected Results
The Issue is created and the JIRA macro is added to the page.

h3. Actual Results
The JIRA macro is added to the page, but, it will only keep loading the project/information to be loaded. Previously, as a different negative symptom, the page would only refresh without results and the URL would look like the following:

https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/spacekey/pages/pageid/page+title?JIRAIssuesCreated=true&numOfIssues=1&issuesURL=https%3A%2F%instance.atlassian.net%2Fbrowse%2FCUS-45&addedToPage=false&issueId=KEY-45&statusText=error
 
h3. Notes
- Repeating the steps will create a successful attempt, then repeating again will result in another failed attempt, and so on repeating and alternating success and failure.
- The JIRA issue is created properly, but the JIRA macro fails to be added every other time.

h3.Workaround
Add the JIRA issue macro manually after a failed creation attempt.
fields.summary: Every other attempt to create a single JIRA issue in Confluence fails to create the JIRA issue macro in the page.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Gray tone PNG images are not rendered properly in Confluence.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload the following image in Confluence:  !linear_gradient.png|thumbnail! 
# Access the page where the image was uploaded and view the attachment in different mode (preview, embedded, original).

h3. Expected Results
The image is displayed exactly the same in the different modes.

h3. Actual Results
The image is rendered differently each time.

In Preview, the image is displayed like this:
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-01 at 16.10.49.png|thumbnail! 

In the page itself, it is displayed like so (slightly altered):
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-01 at 16.10.54.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
This only affects PNG files.


h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Gray PNG images are not rendered properly in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When clicking on a thumbnail of an image in Safari 11, the image failed to download and instead show an error message "We can't preview this file. You'll have to download the file to view it."

h3. Customer Impact
 * Unable to preview the image when using Safari 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Click on any thumbnail image in any pages using Safari.

h3. Expected Results
 * Preview loads with full-size view of the image

h3. Actual Results
 * Preview loads but instead of the full-size view of the image, an error message appears.

h3. Workaround
 * Use a browser different from Safari

h3. Work done so far
 * Root cause identified: current behavior in production shows that most HEAD requests to the conversion api get cancelled, which prevents Safari from continuing any GET requests to obtain the asset and finally preview the images
 * Fix made behind a feature flag to remove the conversion api call in question (please see dev comments in the comment chain)
 * Preview for images is fixed but some preview for files is broken with this change and needs to be addressed before rolling out
fields.summary: Confluence Image preview is not working in Safari 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a blog post page is published. The date on the post is displaying the published date but the URL is displaying the created date.

h3. Customer Impact
Discrepancy between what is shown within the page and the URL

h3. Environment
* Counfluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a blog post, leave it as draft
# The next day, publish

h3. Expected Results
# Date published will be shown as today but the URL will be showing the day the page is published

h3. Actual Results
# Date published will be shown as today but the URL will be showing yesterday's date

h3.Workaround
# No workaround
fields.summary: Confluence Blog posts showing date created in URL instead of date published

fields.description:
When one copies a "Task List" formatted list in the Confluence editor and pasting that content into Confluence, the result is a bulleted list.
I would like to recommend a method to copy/view the wiki-format plaintext for the purpose of pasting back into Confluence for the purpose of being rendered as shown in Confluence.
fields.summary: Unable to Copy "Task List" formatting as it pastes as a bulleted list instead

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new editor, the markdown does not works (either ""__"" or "**" ) for words that starts or ends with the lowercase char "s".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or *edit* a page;
 # While editing a new page, use the markdown to set a word to bold, the word must start or finish with the lowercase 's' char.

h3. Expected Results

The content should be formatted to **bold**

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround

Use the editor tools to make a text *bold.*
fields.summary: Markdown bold not working for words starting or finishing with lowercase 's'

fields.description:
In Confluence, when the user does have the instance in Korean, there's a translation issue for the "*last modified*" sentence. 

Currently, it's being used with "*최정 수정*" and the correct translation should be "*최종 수정*"
fields.summary: Wrong Translation in Korean for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem
We just want to see the title of the issue as the event name in the calendar without the issue key.

h3. Suggestion
Add an option to hide the issue key on Calendars

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Hide Issue Key on Calendars

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The issue is that the IP is changed frequently and we are constantly updating our service provider.

h3. Suggestion
Allow Cloud to work with static IPs

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Static IP

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While having the editor opened for a page, when the user tries to copy content from different cells in a table and then, have it pasted into the same/different table, the content will concatenate into one cell, rather than distributing it across different ones.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create and *edit* a new page
# While editing a new page, be sure to have tables added to it so you can paste content from different cells
# Copy the content from 2 or more different cells
# Paste into the same/another table

h3. Expected Results
The content should be pasted and distributed within different cells:
!cell.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results
The content is pasted all within the same cell 
!different.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
* If you copy the content from the page while on its view mode (not editing), the bug will not be reproduced.

h3.Workaround
Copy the content from the page prior to opening the editor.
fields.summary: Pasting Tables From the Editor Concatenates it into One Cell

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Some of XML Tags encoded differently in Code block macro.

h3. How to Replicate
# Create a page and insert Code block macro.
# Edit the code block macro and set to HTML/XML.
# Insert this sample of XML code(<t>foo</t>) to the code block macro.
# Publish the page.

h3.Expected Result
* Showing the same encoded XML code.

h3.Actual Result
* Showing different encoded XML code.

h3.Workaround
Use HTML and XML language for the Code Block macro.
fields.summary: Some of XML Tags encoded differently in Code block macro.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The documentation states:
{quote}
Once you save your first decision page, Confluence will create a decision register page for the space you're in, and add a shortcut to it in space's sidebar. The decision register and lists all the decisions in that space.
{quote}
_Source:_ [Decisions Blueprint Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/decisions-blueprint-937893638.html]

h3. Expected Behavior
After creating a page based on the blueprint, the Decision Register should be created and appended to the sidebar. 

h3. Actual Behavior
The Page is not created

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Go/Create a Space
# Click on *+* in the sidebar to create a Page
# Choose the Decision Blueprint template
# Create Page
fields.summary: Decision Blueprints not creating "Decision Register" page as described in Documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Word automated numbered headings, the numbered headings won't be added after using the Word import feature.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a Word document with automated numbered headings
# Use the Word import feature to import your Word content.

h3. Expected Results
The headings are numbered just like they are in the Word document.

h3. Actual Results
The headings lose their numbered part upon import.
 
h3. Notes
If a Word table of content is used in the document, the numbered headings will still be displayed in the Word ToC.

h3.Workaround
Manually insert back the numbered headings on Confluence after import.
fields.summary: Word import does not add automated numbered headings

fields.description:
One of the issues with the editor is the cramped bulleted lists, that have no separation between multi-sentence bullet points, making them hard to read (Version A). Imagine the text below was a long list of complex instructions (instead of a brief list of How to Buy a Pumpkin).  

Most people find *Version B* much easier to read, because of the line space between bullets.  However, Confluence doesn't currently provide a way to do that. Hitting return of course just adds another bullet or number, and hitting it twice creates too much space. I have to do a manual workaround of adding a soft return after each bullet, which is still a bit too much space and also doesn't always publish properly.

Version B was done in Word, using the 6 pt. "after paragraph" selection. Is there any way you can add a button in Confluence that does this, enabling users to automatically add a line space between bullets and numbered lists?   That would be a seriously great feature.

h5. Current Behavior (Version A)
 !versionA.jpg|thumbnail! 

h5. Expected Behavior (Version B)
 !versionB.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Line Space button for Bullets or Numbered List

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Page title are empty when user click on an undefined page link.


h2. Steps to replicate

# Create Choose Insert > Link or press Ctrl+K on your keyboard.
# Choose Advanced.
# Enter the name of the page to be created in the Link field and click insert
# Save the page
# Click on the the name you enter on the link field just now


h3. Observed behaviour

A new page will be open without a page title


h3. Expected Behaviour

When you click on the link, Confluence will create a draft page with the title you define in *Link Field*



h3. Workaround

Manually enter the page title
fields.summary: Undefined page link does not create page title when user click on it

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After [Logging in as another user|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/log-in-as-another-user-776994835.html], the popup that prompts users to "switch back to your account" will disappear after any action performed, leaving admins not able to switch back to their original account.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Confluence 1000.0.0-ea5abc6
* Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to Cloud Confluence instance as Site Admin
# [Log in as another user|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/log-in-as-another-user-776994835.html]
{panel}
# Go to user management:
#* In Jira, go to  > User management (or click Settings > User management if you're using the new Jira experience)
#* In Confluence, click Site administration
# Select a user from the list
# Choose the Log in as user button at the top of the page
{panel}
# Perform actions as this users. Example:
#* Switch application from JIRA to Confluence
#* View a page
#* Create a new Page

h3. Expected Results
The popup on the top right that prompts users to "switch back to your account" will remain there.

h3. Actual Results
The popup disappears

h3.Workaround
Go to User Avatar > Profile to re-trigger the popup
fields.summary: "switch back to your account" pop up disappears from screen after any action is performed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Export space to Word with excerpt macro showing a non-breaking space.

h3. How to Replicate
 # Create a page with the excerpt macro e.g Page excerpt macro.
 # Create another page and insert excerpt include macro.
 # Set the excerpt include macro to view e.g Page excerpt macro.
 # Export page to Word.
 # Open the Word file and show the formatting mark.

 Expected Result
 * space before the excerpt macro should be a normal space.

h3. Actual Result
 * The space before the excerpt macro showing a non-breaking space.

h3. Workaround
 # No Workaround
fields.summary: Export space to Word with excerpt macro showing a non-breaking space.

fields.description:
*Summary*

Currently, user will be redirected to *Recently Worked on* when they try to *Close* or *Delete unpublished page* when they creating page.

For example:

User in page 1, when they click on create page (+) and cancel the page creation they will be redirected to *Recently Worked on* tab instead of Page 1.
fields.summary: Redirect to current page when cancelling page creation / Deleting unpublished Draft

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Team Calendars will not load in if a reload of the calendar is triggered without a complete refresh of the page.

h3. Environment
This issue is verified in Google Chrome and FireFox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a team calendar to the Overview page of a space.
# open the space overview and let the calendar load.
# click the "pages" option in the left navigation bar.
# click the "overview" option in the left navigation bar.

h3. Expected Results
The Page loads with the team calendar.
h3. Actual Results
The calendar "spins" indefinitely.
The Following error is thrown in the Javascript Console:
{noformat}
Error: A definition of type "c" with the ID of "results-container" already exists.
    at c (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:3229)
    at Object.init (confluence.macros.advanced:get-more.js?externals=__local-default__:5)
    at confluence.macros.advanced:get-more.js?externals=__local-default__:5
    at Object.safeRequire (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:25)
    at confluence.macros.advanced:get-more.js?externals=__local-default__:5
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
N/A

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Team Calendar will not render in page if page was soft-loaded

fields.description: When Viewing the inherited restrictions for a page that has multiple layers of restrictions, it will display the users who have access to the root-level page first, then lists the users for lower level pages. This will show a larger number of users than the ones that actually have access to the page in question which is not clear on who actually has access to the page through page restrictions.
fields.summary: View Inherited Restrictions displays more users for multiple layers of restrictions.

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/migrate-from-confluence-cloud-to-server-724765578.html#MigratefromConfluenceCloudtoServer-Add-ons

We should be more explicit about the fact that, after the migration, Confluence will not properly render the pages which contain Cloud-only macros.
fields.summary: Improve "Migrate from Confluence Cloud to Server" document, "Add-on" section

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When we don't have access, we are not able to edit the page restrictions from the space tools > content > Page Restrictions. Even if we are able to see it.

h3. Suggestion
Allow managing restrictions for admins from the restrictions page on the space tools of a space.

h3. Workaround
Log as a user with access on the User Management and edit the restrictions
fields.summary: Allow to edit restrictions from Space Tools

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Ability to export space without page history.

h3. How to Replicate
# Go to space tools.
# Export space to XML.

h3.Expected Result
* Have an option to export without page history.

h3.Actual Result
* Export to XML will include the page history.

h3.Workaround
# Use Copy page tree add-on, refer to below documentation link:
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Is-there-a-way-to-export-spaces-without-history-pages-in/qaq-p/652343
fields.summary: Ability to export space without page history.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 29 September 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi everyone,

Great news – we have now released undo/redo buttons to 100% of Confluence Cloud customers! We've also made many improvements to the behaviour and predictability of undo/redo, whether using the buttons or using keyboard shortcuts. (In regards to redo shortcut, on a Mac it is cmd + shift + z.)

Thank you again for your feedback, and your patience as we rolled this out. 

Thank you,

Rachel Crossman 
Senior Product Manager - Editor
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

In the previous version of the Confluence editor, there was an *Undo* and a *Redo* button:
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-30 at 3.06.37 PM.png|thumbnail!

These have been removed as part of the implementation of the new editor, but keyboard shortcuts are still possible.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add buttons in the toolbar to be able to redo or undo changes
h3. Why this is important
 * Non-technical users may not know about the keyboard shortcuts, thus it's important to have the buttons on the editor.
 * To meet the Golden Rules of Interface Design: *Permit easy reversal of actions*

h3. Workaround
 * Use keyboard shortcuts:
 ** *Undo* — PC: {{Ctrl+Z}}, Mac: {{⌘+Z}}
 ** *Redo* — PC: {{Ctrl+Y}}, Mac: {{⌘+ Y}} or {{Shift+⌘+Z}}
 * Right-click in the editor and select "Undo"
 * (Mac only) Select "Undo" from the Edit menu
fields.summary: Include an 'undo' and 'redo' option in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Custom homepages do not load properly on Mobile Browsers
h3. Description

You can change a site's homepage to be one of your Space's homepages.
 Unfortunately, it appears that when you do this to a site, you will not be able to view it's homepage when accessing through a mobile browser. (Safari's iPhone, Chrome's Android, etc.)

This is also happening to general Confluence page's links.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Settings* > *Further Configuration* > *Homepage*
 # Change the homepage from *dashboard* to one of your space's keys.
 # Save the changes
 # Navigate to this instance through a mobile browser.

h3. Expected Results

The page should load.
h3. Actual Results

The page isn't loaded, instead, there's a message like below:
{quote}That page ID is invalid. Page IDs can only contain numbers. Double-check the URL and give it another shot.
{quote}
h3. Workarounds

Set the dashboard as the default homepage for your site.
fields.summary: Custom homepages do not load properly on Mobile Browsers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you press 'Ctrl+F' key combination the new editor won't open its 'Find/Replace' tool, but it will open the browser's instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page
# Press 'Ctrl+F' on your keyboard

h3. Expected Results
The editor's 'Find/Replace' tool would open.
h3. Actual Results
The browser's 'Find/Replace' is opened instead.
 
h3. Notes
This only happens on the new editor (TinyMCE 4)

h3.Workaround
Click the magnifying glass icon on the top right corner of the editor, next to the 'Feedback' link.
fields.summary: 'Ctrl+F' doesn't open editor's 'Find/Replace' on the new editor

fields.description:
h4. Steps to replicate
# Create a page
# Upload an image that has a grey colour.

h4. Actual Behavior
Grey colour is posterized

h4. Expected Behavior
Quality stays the same
fields.summary: Grey images are posterized after uploaded to a page
Unable to leave an inline comment in a table cell with a background colour

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of July 9th 2019| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#cccccc| titleBGColor=#dddddd| bgColor=#ffffff}

 Hey everyone,

Thanks for voting on this issue and letting us know what is important for your needs. 
We have now disallowed anonymous users to see "space settings" unless anonymous users have space export or space admin permissions for the space. 

Alice Wang
Development Team Lead, Confluence Cloud 

{panel}

 

[This article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-hide-the-space-tools-menu-for-anonymous-users-in-confluence-816877024.html] talks about a way to achieve this on Confluence Server and points out it's not possible to use the same solution in Confluence Cloud.

Could another approach be offered for Confluence Cloud? As an admin, right now the pencil icon along the sidebar allows me to hide other things such as the Blog or Overview. It sure would be great if we could do the same for Space Tools.

The use case is that we're considering moving our public docs site to Confluence, but the Space Tools exposes some internal stuff (e.g. names of Administrators) that we're not really keen to open up to the world.
fields.summary: Allow option to hide the Space Tools menu for Anonymous Users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Table cells containing Due Dates and other Text info will result on wrong table cells ordering
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Confluence page, create a table with >=3 rows
 # Add one date - with // macro - on each cell - Make sure at least one of them is in a different month than the others
 # Add some text on the same cell as the dates.
 # Publish the page
 # Try to reorder the table

h3. Expected Results

Table should display all dates in the correct order. e.g.:

!table1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Dates are ordered wrong. e.g.:

!table2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Table cells containing Due Dates and other Text info will result on wrong table cells ordering

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Multimedia Macro Fullscreen option in Chrome is not showing.

h3. How to Replicate
# Create the page.
# Insert video with extension e.g mp4
# Insert the multimedia macro.

h3.Expected Result
* Able to have the option to fullscreen in Chrome browser.

h3.Actual Result
* On browser chrome doesn't have the option to fullscreen.

h3.Workaround
# Use another browser e.g Firefox or IE.
fields.summary: Multimedia Macro Fullscreen option in Chrome is not showing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When highlighting some text and inserting an *Excerpt* macro, the highlighted text is not inserted in the new macro but replaced by the empty macro instead.
It is working properly when inserting the *Excerpt* macro with the *{* shortcut.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Highlight some text on a page.
# Manually attempt to insert a new *Excerpt* macro with the text still highlighted.

h3. Expected Results
The new *Excerpt* macro is inserted with the highlighted text included in it.

h3. Actual Results
The new *Excerpt* macro is inserted but the highlighted text is removed.
 
h3.Workaround
Use the *{* shortcut then open the macro browser and select the *Excerpt* macro.
fields.summary: Inserting an Excerpt macro after highlighting the text deletes its instead of including it in the macro

fields.description:
This is very hard to reproduce, but the symptom is that _very rarely_ you aren't able to type in the letter 's'. It is likely other keys might occur as well. The editor can get into a situation where it thinks the Command key is down, which would prevent entering text, instead all letters would attempt to fire shortcuts.

Observed in Mac Chrome 61.
fields.summary: Sometimes you can't type an 's' into the editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing the "All-Updates" tab of the Confluence "Activity" page, it is possible for anyone to se the "[spacename] Calendars" page listed, even if the user does not have access to the space that the page belongs to.
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a space with a calendars page such that the "[spacename] Calendars" page update shows up in the activities.
 # View the Activity page with a user that does not have access to the space in question

h3. Expected Results

The unprivileged user would not see the Calendars page in the stream.
h3. Actual Results

Any user (including anonymous users) will see the "[Spacename] Calendars" in the all-updates activity stream from the Confluence "Activity" page.
h3. Notes

The "Calendars" page is the page that allows a user to create a new calendar, not the calendars themselves.
 This issue leaks space names to all users which may imply sensitive information.
h3. Workaround

Update the calendar (edit the name/ description/ move calendar to another space etc)

Content restriction is applied on calendar creation and update - the bug fix that introduced is detailed in CONFCLOUD-56472. 

This means that any calendars created before the restrictions bug fix does not have the proper restriction applied, and updating the calendar will apply the restriction.
fields.summary: Team Calendars page in each space shows up to all users in the activity page All-Updates activity stream
Site Import Fails with Duplicate User Exception

fields.description:
Hi, 

is it possible to create a JIRA issue directly from team calendar?

Thanks a lot
fields.summary: Ability to create Jira issue from Team Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Preformatted text runs out of page bounds

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a section with preformatted text in a page
# Insert enough text for 2 lines. 

h3. Expected Results
Text should remain between page bounds.

h3. Actual Results
Text runs out of page bounds 
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-26 at 1.39.21 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Not use Preformatted for text.
fields.summary: Preformatted text runs out of page bounds

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Approximately 2 weeks ago, a customer has not been able to use labels created with the non-alphanumeric character "**".* There are topics created with the same syntax such as {{electric*}}.

There is now a restriction where administrators or users are no longer able to create labels with those characters.

h3.Steps to Replicate
The only instance that had labels prior to the change of infrastructure from Questions are able to replicate.
fields.summary: Labels created with non-alphanumeric characters are no longer able to be used

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Exporting pages containing JIRA ticket status to PDF results in unloaded statuses

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Step 1 - Have a Confluence page with Jira ticket statuses
# Step 2 - Export to PDF

h3. Expected Results
Results should show all ticket statuses

h3. Actual Results
Some ticket statuses render, while some are exported as in progress


h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Exporting pages containing JIRA ticket status to PDF results in unloaded statuses

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the addition of new languages in the Confluence Cloud ecosystems, users opting for Norwegian or having Norwegian browser settings and the "detect browser settings" feature enabled  have noticed that some menu elements in the Norwegian translation of Confluence are not correct or showing untranslated text.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Set Confluence Cloud site-level language settings to Norwegian, or have Norwegian as the selected language in browser and the "detect browser settings enabled."

h3. Expected Results
All interface items should be in Norwegian.

h3. Actual Results
Some interface items are not translated or display wrong characters:
 !image002 (1).png|thumbnail! 
 !Pasted image at 2017_10_20 04_28 PM (1).png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-26 at 09.45.43.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
There is no workaround, save for switching back to English.
fields.summary: The language pack for Confluence Cloud is not complete in Norwegian

fields.description:
With the editor UX changes, we are now using markdown syntax for monospace (backticks), so `monospace` instead of our old wikimarkup syntax which was {{monospace } }.

On keyboards QWERTZ (i.e., German, Austrian, Swiss, etc.), the backtick requires shift, and it prefers accented keys. So trying to enter a plain backtick, results in nothing in the editor, until you enter your next key. If for the next key you enter an "a", you'll get à. If you enter a character that doesn't have an accented version, like "n", you'll get the backtick followed by an n: `n. So it requires some fiddling to enter your text with a preceding backtick.

Furthermore, entering the close backtick is also difficult. You need to do it twice, which does close the markdown autoformatting, but you are left with a second backtick.

The workaround is to use the keyboard shortcuts which are considerably easier on this keyboard.
* Mac: Command + Shift + m
* PC: Control + Shift + m
fields.summary: Monospace markdown auto-formatting on non-English keyboards is tricky

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Editing a page and publishing it will move the page to the root parent page. Another observation, if you try to move back the page to the correct parent, the breadcrumb is not displaying

h3. Customer Impact
Page structure is incorrect.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page and once publish it will move the page unintentionally 

h3. Expected Results
Publishing a page does not move it to a different parent

h3. Actual Results
_The page is moved._

h3.Workaround  
Rebuild ancestor table
https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/permissions/rebuild_ancestor_table.action
fields.summary: Editing and Publishing a page will move the page to the root parent page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When changing the Date Format in *Settings > General Configuration* to "dd/mm/yy", the date breaks the month count as per the screenshot below:
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-25 at 11.51.35.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Go to *Settings > General Configuration*
# Change *Date Format* to "dd/mm/yy"
#* The only way I've found where to replicate the bug is by going to a created User Template.
# Go to a Space, then *Space Tools > Content Tools > Templates*
# Look at the created date

h3. Workaround
Change the *Date Format* from "dd/mm/yy" to "dd/MM/yy"
fields.summary: Date Format with lowercase "M" breaks the month count.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*Confluence Page Gadget* not working in JIRA Dashboard, as it is not possible to search for page in the gadget.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add *Confluence Page Gadget* to JIRA Dashboard
# Try to search for page

h3. Expected Results
It should display suggestions in a dropdown when you start typing.

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't have a suggestion dropdown. Entering the page name doesn't work either.
fields.summary: Confluence Page Gadget not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When JIRA Custom Fields name contains comma (,) JIRA Macro identify the comma as a separator and does not include the field values in the JIRA Macro table generated in Confluence

 

Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field that include a comma, add value.
 # Create a JIRA Macro in a Confluence page
 # Include the custom field that contains a comma
 # Publish page. 

 

!Screenshot from 2017-10-25 18.30.04.png|thumbnail! !Screenshot from 2017-10-25 18.31.26.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

Values are shown in Custom field column
h3. Actual Results

_Empty values are shown and the header is separated where the commas are positioned._
h3. Workaround  

Remove commas from JIRA Custom Fields
fields.summary: Jira Macro column values not appearing when Custom Field (Jira) name contains comma

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Many Users/Companies use Prezis in their daily work for internal/public purposes, but currently, it is not possible to embed these Prezi presentations on their Confluence pages. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to embed Prezi Presentations on their pages using macros such as [Widget Connector Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/widget-connector-macro-724765314.html], which allows embedding online videos, slideshows, photostreams and more on Confluence pages.
fields.summary: Allow users to embed Prezi presentations to pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing a table in a page, copy-paste data from any source (such as notepad on windows).
Pasting the data into a cell will cause a new cell to appear in the row (causing it to have more columns than all other rows) This content will eventually resolve to either just above or just below the table.

h3. Environment
Cloud.
Known to effect the following browsers:
- Firefox 56.0 64 bit

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy data to be pasted into a cell from notepad or some source.
# Paste that data into a cell

h3. Expected Results

The data is pasted into the cell without issues.

h3. Actual Results

The data is inserted just above, just below, or a new cell is created.
 
h3. Notes
This issue does not seem to occur in a consistent way, but rather is intermittent.
It is also worthy to note that this issue was able to be reproduced by simply hitting "shift + enter" to create a newline in a table that had previously had text pasted into it from earlier failed attempts.

h3.Workaround
There is no known workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Paste in tables can cause corruption in table

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you're viewing a page that has a table and you try to select the whole table the header is simply not highlighted as selected.
Even when you extend the selection to a text above the table the header isn't selected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add a table to it
# The table must have a header row and some rows below it
# Save the page and while viewing it select the table, bottom to top

h3. Expected Results
When your selection reaches the header, the header is selected as well.
h3. Actual Results
The header isn't selected at all. See below:

 !table.gif! 
 

h3.Workaround
Edit the page and copy the table from the editor.
fields.summary: Table header can't be selected when viewing a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User reported that he sees a label behind watch page button in ADG3 layout




h3. Steps to Reproduce
Open a page in Confluence
Press Ctrl+a (an area behind/to the right the watch page button will be selected)

h3. Expected Results
Label should not be there?

h3. Actual Results
Label is there


 
h3. Notes
It's a does not impact usability in any way

h3.Workaround
none
fields.summary: Unused label next to/behind watch page button in ADG3 layout

fields.description:
Summary
* PDF Export filename should similar with the title of the page.

Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.1257.2

How to Replicate
* Go to any page, export page to PDF.

Expected result:
* PDF filename with the title of the page.

Actual result:
* PDF filename has 'SpaceKey-PageName-ConfluenceDateTime' format.

Workaround
* No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: PDF Export filename should similar with the title of the page.

fields.description:
Just as described, users are seeing different content based on browser. I haven't been able to replicate the issue. 

Firefox version is 54.0.1 (32-bit)
OS : Windows 7
fields.summary: Confluence discrepancy seemingly based on browser.
REST API for creation template wrong format cause by escape the xml tag

fields.description:
h3. Problem
We want to apply suggested pages from Your Work home screen on Confluence Your Work tab at the moment this function is only available at home together with JIRA.

h3. Suggestion
Apply the same feature to Confluence

h3. Workarounds
None
fields.summary: Apply suggested pages from Your Work home screen on Confluence

fields.description:
In Confluence, when the user accesses a space, the same goes to the *Overview* page. However, when going to a different page, Confluence will not have the *Overview* option displayed anymore. In order to get back, the user will need to either:

# Click on *Pages* so the option will be displayed back in the sidebar.
# Click on the space logo > Space Dropdown > name of the current space

This is a suggestion to have a more intuitive/easier method to allow the users to access the Overview of the space when already working inside the same.
fields.summary: More Intuitive Method to Reach Space Overview

fields.description:
After trashing a page, the mobile metadata endpoint gives a 404 but the mobile content body endpoint does not, which is inconsistent. On the client this results in the page HTML loading but the metadata being missing.

Endpoint giving a 404: https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/rest/nativemobile/1.0/content/3202613701/metadata

Endpoint not giving a 404: https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/rest/nativemobile/1.0/content/3202613701/
fields.summary: Mobile endpoint gives 404 for trashed content

fields.description:
By default, you can export Confluence spaces and pages to different formats. In addition to that, when a user haves a new site with the same set of users, it would be easier to be able to use the same permissions with an export, instead of needing to set this up manually.

This is a suggestion to have Confluence able to export its Global, Space Permissions and Page Restrictions, so it will not need to be done manually.
fields.summary: Ability to Export Permissions

fields.description:
h2. *Current Behaviour*

At the moment, it's not possible to make any changes to activity stream or even hide it

h2. *Requested Behaviour*

All users activities will be shown in the Activity tab. If a user created a public page and then restricted it afterwards, anonymous still be able to see who created what page from the activity tab but they won't have the permission to view it once clicked. It would be great if Admin can clear the activity stream to prevent this.
fields.summary: Allow admin user to clear the activity stream

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to login [https://wekaio-jst325781.atlassian.net|https://wekaio-jst325781.atlassian.net/]
h3. Environment

Vertigo
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access instance via governator
 # You will directed to user management
 # Try to access confluence 

h3. Expected Results

You are able to access confluence
h3. Actual Results

Not able to login to Confluence 

See the following errors in Splunk 

 
{code:java}
Could not find user by Atlassian Account Id AccountId{value='557057:9fc146ff-9b00-477c-ace0-7efff26de778'}
{code}
 

**Notes

We noticed this morning that Confluence data was missing for this customer. [https://wekaio.atlassian.net/]

Requested the Monarch team ([https://sdog.jira-dev.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/20/KALIHELP-147)] to restore the data to a temporary instance ([https://wekaio-jst325781.atlassian.net)|https://wekaio-jst325781.atlassian.net%29/]. The data has been restored but we cannot access the instance now. 

 
h3.
fields.summary: Unable to login to https://wekaio-jst325781.atlassian.net after a restore

fields.description:
h2. *Current Behaviour*

Not possible to manage watcher. 

h2. *Requested Behaviour*

Previously, admin user have the ability to manage watchers in Confluence Question Topics:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

With the new Confluence Question, this is no longer possible. It would be great to have this functionality back in the new Confluence Question.
fields.summary: Allow admin users to manage watcher for Confluence Question Topics

fields.description:
Similar to [this request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-6390], this is a suggestion created to allow Confluence to switch to Read-Only mode in the Mobile version. 

For example, the users will still be able to edit content while accessing through the desktop, and while accessing using the Mobile version, the same can use an option to have it Read-Only.
fields.summary: Option to Switch to Read-Only for the Mobile Version of Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you include a macro in the header and/or footer configured in the space's look and feel setting, this macro will show on all pages of the space.

However, macros that dynamically change based on the current page being viewed are not rendered correctly. These include:
 * Attachments
 * Child pages
 * Page tree (when it does not define a root page for the tree)

h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud with the new look and navigation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Configure the space header and/or footer to have an attachments macro 
{code:java}
{attachments}{code}
2. Navigate to a page that has attachments, and observe the the macro shows "No files shared here yet."
h3. Expected Results

The attachments macro in the header / footer shows the attachments for the currently viewed page.
h3. Actual Results

The attachments macro in the header / footer shows "No files shared here yet.
h3.
fields.summary: Macros that need a page context aren't rendered in the header or footer

fields.description:
h3. Summary

CMYK images may display different or blurred colors when saved on Custom Size
h3. Description

Some images generated in CMYK instead of RGB  - *PNG* and *TIFF* mostly - when saved on a custom size, might have differences in colors. It might cause some blur on colors, making it appear as the color has 'leaked'.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page
 # Paste/Attach a CMYK image file to the page
 # Resize it to any size other than 'Original'
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The image should display normally.
h3. Actual Results

The image is displayed, however, the colors are not accurate to the original attached file.

 

Original

!Original.png|thumbnail!

Resized

!Resized.png|width=100,height=100,thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Paste / Attach the image with a different format - such as JPEG.
fields.summary: CMYK images may display different or blurred colors when saved on Custom Size

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Updates from https://status.atlassian.com/|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5 }

*Resolved* - We have confirmed Confluence services are fully restored. 
Oct 20, 14:14 UTC

*Monitoring* - Between 12:00 GMT and 13:07 GMT customers were unable to access Confluence. Our teams identified an expired SSL certificate as the cause of this incident. The team applied a new certificate at 13:07 GMT to restore service to customers. 

We are verifying all services have been restored and apologize for the service interruption to Confluence customers. 
Oct 20, 13:45 UTC
_____
{panel}

When accessing confluence or doing any action, error are triggered - as 'Something went Wrong' on several pages.

Also, the following exception is displayed:
java.lang.RuntimeException: Hystrix circuit short-circuited and is OPEN

 !CC_SearchQuery_10.20.17_818aEST.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customers are unable to access Confluence

fields.description: Please add syntax highlighting support for  Kotlin and/or Swift to the Code Block macro
fields.summary: Add Kotlin and Swift Syntax Highlighting Support to the Code Block Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Under uncertain circumstances it is possible to create an answer to a question that cannot be edited. Furthermore, any links in the answer show up with their proper blue and underline, however they do not link to anything and clicking on them does nothing.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
! Note, the specific catalyst for this bug has not yet been identified. It seems to be related to Links as the links in the answer are also impacted.

Symptom 1.
- Attempt to edit the answer to a question in "Questions for Confluence" that is impacted.

Symptom 2.
- Attempt to Follow the link in an impacted Answer.


h3. Expected Results

Symptom 1.
- You are able to edit the answer without issues.

Symptom 2.
- The Link opens and you are taken to the link target.

h3. Actual Results

Symptom 1.
- The editor textbox opens with no buttons except for the "save" and "Cancel" button, neither of which will react to anything.
- You will get this error in the Browser Console:
{noformat}
Uncaught (in promise) RangeError: No value supplied for attribute href
    at computeAttrs (editor.js:1)
    at v.create (editor.js:1)
    at converter (editor.js:1)
    at parseDomNode (editor.js:1)
    at t.a (editor.js:1)
    at ConfluenceTransformer.parse (editor.js:1)
    at Editor.i.handleRef (editor.js:1)
    at attachRef (vendor.js:1)
    at Object.o.attachRefs (vendor.js:1)
    at ReactDOMComponent.attachRefs (vendor.js:1)
{noformat}
======

Symptom 2.
- The Link goes nowhere and does nothing
- The Link target also does not show up on hover.
 
h3. Notes
N/A

h3.Workaround
No Workaround At this time.
fields.summary: Some Answers in Confluence Questions can become impossible to edit.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a page is exported to PDF and there is a Roadmap Planner macro on this page the title of the bars are cut off on the exported page. The visual of the Roadmap Planner macro differs on the PDF from the original page, which isn't ideal since you configured the Roadmap Planner bars on the page but when the page is exported the layout is different.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Roadmap Planner macro to a page
# Edit the macro and configure the title of the bars in a way that viewing the bar the title is full
# Export the page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
The exported PDF would have the same visuals from the page and the title of the bars would be full.
h3. Actual Results
The exported PDF has the title of the bars cut off, which is different from what we see when viewing the original page.
 
h3. Notes
See screenshots below from the page and the exported PDF of the page:

 !Page.jpg|thumbnail!              !PDF.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Exporting page to PDF, Roadmap Planner macro bars have text cut off
[Backend] Experimental Search API does not send 'search_performed' webhook

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The move blog dialog is not rendering properly on IE 11 browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

On a blog, click on the three dot menu > *Move*

h3. Expected Results

The dialog should show the drop down list of the available spaces to move the blog.

 !working.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Actual Results

The drop down list is hidden in the dialog.
 
 !move blog.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround

- Use Firefox or Google Chrome to move the blog.
- On IE11 : If the space name is known, type the name in the hidden field and press enter. 

 !type.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Move blog dialog not working properly on IE11

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently there is no live chat option available in Confluence
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if we have a LiveChat in Confluence so that users can chat among in each other via the web browser
fields.summary: Implement a Live Chat system in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Broken images are shown in the email notifications for page updates and comments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Watch a page
# Add an Image to the page or add an Image in the comment section.

h3. Expected Results

The image thumbnails should be shown on the email.

h3. Actual Results
Broken images are rendered on the email.

Page Update :  !page update.png|thumbnail! 
Comments :  !comment.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Broken images on Email notifications

fields.description:
Some customers would like to be able to add more labels to a single Navigation Map Macro.

Currently, there's no syntax that would allow adding more than one label, as the field is passed as a parameter on a CQL statement.
fields.summary: Allow Navigation Map Macro to search for more than one label

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the [Blog Posts Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/blog-posts-macro-139470.html] configured to display *excerpts* of a Blog, the same will not render images from the Blog Post. Instead, it will be rendered as pure text:

!moment.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Blog Post in Confluence and insert an image to it
# Edit a new page in Confluence
# On this page *Insert > Macros > Other Macros* select the *Blog Posts*
# Make sure to configure the first option of display to be *Excerpts*
# Save the macro configuration and then, *Publish* the page
h3. Expected Results
The Blog Post macro should display the image with the content of the blog without issues.
h3. Actual Results
No image is displayed. Instead, it's displayed as pure text. 

h3. Notes
All the other text is properly displayed. A screenshot for the expected behavior has also been attached.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Blog Posts Macro Does not Include Image with Excerpt Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a Numbered or Ordered List is added to a Table in Confluence, it adds an extra line break after the Numbered/Ordered List line:
 !ListLineBreaks.gif! 
This occurs both when using the Numbered/Ordered List Buttons and Keyboard Shortcuts (# or *) 

h3. Suggested Solution
When the Numbered or Ordered List button is clicked within a table, preserve the number of line breaks within
This extra line break does not seem to appear if a Numbered/Ordered List is added outside of a Table
 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Remove Extra Line Break When Lists are Used in a Table

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Blog pages doesn't have posting date date picker at the bottom-left corner while creating one like on the image below:
image below

 !PostingDate.jpg|thumbnail! 
 !missingblogoption.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Cloud - 1000.0.0-285e41d

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to create a new blog page from template
# You will be redirected to the edit page to create content on the page
# On this blog page you will not find the field to set a posting date as on the images attached.

h3. Expected Results
Blog posting date date picker should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
No posting date field.
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Blog pages doesn't have posting date date picker at the bottom-left corner

fields.description:
This is a request to allow Confluence to have the ability to place a button that moves a row from a table on one page to a table on another. 

Specifically this button would be only visible to a specific user group or user and it would also show on the edit history which user has pressed the button.
fields.summary: Ability to Move a Row from a Table into a Different Table in Other Page

fields.description:
Similar to the [Import Mail function of Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf56/importing-mail-658737021.html] users might want to easily import emails in Confluence with a simple function. 

This is a request to have a feature that would allow emails to be imported in Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: Ability to Import Emails Into Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding a style macro to a page with a Team Calendar, the dialog box for the calendar will be centered on the page instead of the browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Create a page
- Add a Team calendar
- Add a Style macro (blank)
- Publish the page
- Edit a date in the calendar

h3. Expected Results

The dialog will be shown on the center of the browser regardless of the window size.
 !without style macro.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The dialog will be centered on the page and the user has to scroll down the browser to show the dialog.
 !with syle macro.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Style macro causes the dialog of team calendars to not be centered

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users would like a way to display the current version of a page on Confluence, but this is not possible as there is no macro for it, and it's not possible to write a User Macro in Cloud due to restricted functions.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a macro that could display the version of a page, and possibly even other information about the page, much like what is displayed on the information page automatically. Could even modify an existing macro, such as Page Properties
fields.summary: Provide a macro to display version of a page and other page info

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Breadcrumbs are rendered in reverse.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This only happens on certain instances
# Login to the affected instance
# Go to an arbitrary page
# Verify the breadcrumbs are rendered backwards partially

h3. Expected Results
Confluence renders breadcrumbs in correct order

h3. Actual Results
Although the database records (confancestors) are correct, the breadcrumbs are rendered in reverse.

h3. Notes
* Root cause is unknown

h3.Workaround
* None
fields.summary: Some breadcrumbs rendered backwards

fields.description:
h3.Summary
Allow administrators to configure the settings of Recommended Updates, such as a minimum number of likes or comments in order to trigger the job that sends the email to users. 

h3.Actual Behavior
There is a defined number of three pages that are sent on the Recommended Updates, and for smaller instances, it would be good to have such a granular configuration, since the number of pages created, liked or comment is small.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to configure Recommended Updates

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers performing an HTML Export of their Spaces have noticed that no Comments are being exported

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add Comments to a Confluence Page
# Navigate through Space Tools > Export > HTML Export > Custom Export 
#- Ensure that Include Comments is Selected
# Select pages 
# Export 

h3. Expected Results
Per the selected option, Comments are Exported

h3. Actual Results
No Comments are Exported
!View-Page.png|thumbnail! 
!HTML-Export.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The Normal Export states:
{quote}Generates a HTML file for each page in this space, *excluding* blogs, comments, and attachments.{quote}
Not sure if this should also affect Custom HTML Exports; if so, the "Include Comments" Checkbox should be removed
 !CustomHTMLExportOptions.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
None. If you don't mind making development effort, consider to retrieve comments via [REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-child-comment-get] and export them into the expected format (HTML, in this case).
fields.summary: Page Comments Not Exported During Space Tools HTML Export

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Images with Effects are not rendered
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence, add an Image to a page
 # Add any effect to the image
 # Save the Page

h3. Expected Results

The images should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

Images are not displayed - instead there's only a blank space. No errors are displayed on the UI. On the back end, the following message is logged:
{code:java}
WARN: Transform failed for reason: CLIENT_NOT_CONFIGURED{code}
h3. Workaround
 * Remove any effects from the image
 * Remove the image and add it back again to the page.
fields.summary: Images with Effects are not rendered

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With Confluence Cloud new layout it is no longer possible to set a custom site homepage per user as it can only be done for all users.

h3. Suggested Solution
 Re-introduce the ability to set a custom site homepage per user as it was possible with Confluence former layout.

h3. Workaround 
Add the specific space you wish to have as a personalised site homepage to your favourite so that a link is added to *My Spaces* in the Global sidebar when viewing Confluence main homepage.
fields.summary: Re-introduce custom site homepage per user in Confluence Cloud

fields.description: When user tries to edit a status macro, he/she sees 2 fields of status names
fields.summary: Status macro has 2 fields of status name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users who are invited to Edit an Existing Page are unable to use the Link in their Email to access the page to edit

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit an Existing Page within Confluence
# Click on the + Icon in the Upper Right Corner and input a User to share the page with
# User B receives Email Notification and clicks on the "Start Editing" link

h3. Expected Results
User B is able to edit the page they were linked

h3. Actual Results
Browser refreshes and displays a spinner with an error message:
{quote}Something went wrong after loading the editor. Copy your unsaved changes and refresh the page to keep editing.{quote}
 !EditFromNotification.png|thumbnail! 

Browser Dev Console shows Synchrony 404 and 400 Errors
{code}
POST https://synchrony.atlassian.io/v1/data/-f67a41f2-7cbe-3f5e-9178-cdd3840cf20d/confluence-78479374?state-at=@head&state-format=type-tagged&rewrite-request=true&cached=true 404 ()

POST https://synchrony.atlassian.io/v1/data/-f67a41f2-7cbe-3f5e-9178-cdd3840cf20d/confluence-78479374?optimistic=true&rewrite-request=true 400 ()

f._bindEditor @ com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-collaborative-editor-plugin:confluence-collaborative-editor-plugin-resources.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:183

h3. Notes
- If this is a Brand New page, Invited Users are able to Edit it without error. 
- User Invited to Edit has permissions to the Space and Page and they can edit it normally by navigating to it in Confluence. 
-- In my test, I invited myself to Edit
- The URL appears to navigate to a Create Page rather than Edit Page
{noformat}/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/pages/create?draftId=78479374&draftShareId={noformat}
Expected Edit Page URL:
{noformat}/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/pages/edit/78512131?draftId=78479374&draftShareId={noformat}

h3.Workaround
Share the Page from Page View using the Share Button .  User will receive notification that the Page has been shared with them and can Edit it from there.
fields.summary: Users Unable to Edit Existing Page from Edit Invitation Notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After deleting a group from the Site Administration, the group keeps showing up on the Global Permissions page with a _group not found_ message - it also happens when we migrate data from server to cloud products, in case the group do not exist in the cloud environment.
 
 * !deleted_group.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a site administration and delete a group
 # Go to Global Permissions page and remove all permissions for the Deleted group.

h3. Expected Results
The deleted group should disappear from the Global Permissions page.

h3. Actual Results
The deleted group keeps showing on the Global Permissions page with a _group not found_ message.

h3. Workaround
Raise a support ticket in our [customer portal|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/], mentioning this bug request. Our team will talk to you and get the deleted groups removed from the Global Permissions session.
fields.summary: Deleted or Unexisting groups can't be removed from Global Permissions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With the [Atlassian Companion App|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/blog/2017/06/edit-attached-files-with-the-apps-on-your-desktop], the users are able to directly edit the file on Office and then, have it updated directly on Confluence. 

However, if the user inserts the same attachment on a different page (through *insert > Files and Images > Search on Other Pages*) and tries to edit it there, the changes will not be applied to any of the attachments. Instead, a new version of the attachment will be displayed on the attachments history (Page Tools (...) > Attachments).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a file on Page A (let's call it 'Page A' and 'Page B')
# Insert the same file on Page B through *Insert Files and Images > Search on Other Pages > Page A*
# Update the file with Companion on Page B

h3. Expected Results
The changes should be applied to the file attached on both pages.

h3. Actual Results
The file will not be updated on the pages. Instead, if the user accesses the attachments of the page (through ellipsis > Attachments) and clicks on the link for the same, it will download an updated version of the file. 
 
h3. Notes
The same *does not happen* if the user updates the file on Page A. By updating the file on the original page, it will properly work. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Edit Attachments with Companion Does not Work for Documents in Multiple Pages
